decks.notes: The deck focuses on using Animar's ability to reduce the cost of creature spells and generate additional mana to quickly play powerful creatures and combo pieces. The deck includes a variety of creatures with enter the battlefield effects, mana dorks, and tutors to assemble key combos. It aims to generate a large amount of mana, draw cards, and ramp into game-ending threats like Eldrazi creatures or a combo involving Cloudstone Curio and creatures with low mana costs. The deck's strategy revolves around efficiently casting creatures, protecting Animar, and leveraging its ability to quickly overwhelm opponents with a strong board presence.

The deck is focused on building a strong board presence quickly and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful synergies. Marath, Will of the Wild is utilized as the commander to take advantage of its abilities to create creatures, remove threats, and control the battlefield. The deck includes a wide range of ramp spells, tutors, and utility creatures to support the strategy of deploying threats efficiently and effectively. Additionally, there are key combo pieces such as Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Craterhoof Behemoth to seal the deal and finish off opponents. With a solid mana base and a variety of powerful cards, this aggro deck aims to pressure the opponent and secure victory through combat.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive Goblin creatures, utilizing Grenzo, Dungeon Warden as the commander. With a mix of mana acceleration, disruption, and tribal synergies, the deck aims to flood the board with Goblins and utilize cards like Goblin Rabblemaster, Krenko, Mob Boss, and Siege-Gang Commander to generate a massive amount of tokens and overwhelm the opponent quickly. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Pyroblast, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Red Elemental Blast to control the opponent's board and disrupt their game plan. With powerful finishers like Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Living Death, the deck is designed to end the game swiftly and decisively.

The deck revolves around using control elements to disrupt your opponent's strategy while gradually gaining card advantage and manipulating the graveyard with Tasigur, the Golden Fang. By utilizing a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw, the goal is to outvalue the opponent and control the flow of the game. Tasigur serves as both a threat on the board and a source of card advantage, allowing you to consistently answer threats and generate value over time. The deck is designed to be flexible and adaptable, with a range of answers to handle different types of threats while maintaining a strong board presence and resource advantage.

The deck focuses on utilizing Grenzo, Dungeon Warden's ability to put Goblin creatures from the bottom of your library onto the battlefield. With a heavy Goblin tribal theme, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive strategy, supported by cards like Goblin Chieftain, Goblin Matron, and Siege-Gang Commander. Additionally, the deck includes various disruptive elements such as Blood Moon and Thoughtseize to disrupt opponents' strategies and clear the way for your own creatures to dominate the battlefield. By combining aggressive creatures with disruption and card advantage, the deck seeks to establish early control of the game and maintain pressure on opponents until victory is achieved.

The deck revolves around using Narset, Enlightened Master as the commander to control the game through a combination of powerful spells and efficient counterspells. It focuses on manipulating the opponent's gameplay by countering their threats and disrupting their strategy. The deck includes a variety of board wipes like Supreme Verdict and Wrath of God to clear the battlefield when necessary. It also includes extra turn spells like Time Warp and Temporal Trespass to gain an advantage in the game. The deck aims to control the pace of the game while using Narset's ability to cast spells for free to eventually overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells and planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures early on to put pressure on the opponent, while also utilizing powerful burn spells to control the board and finish off the opponent. The deck includes mana dorks to accelerate its mana curve, as well as versatile creatures like Courser of Kruphix and Thrun, the Last Troll for resilience. It also includes powerful planeswalkers like Garruk Wildspeaker and Chandra, Pyromaster for additional threats and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon and Price of Progress, while also using efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Beast Within to deal with threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive creatures and burn spells to secure a quick victory.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with a wide array of counterspells, hand disruption, removal spells, and board wipes. Tasigur, the Golden Fang serves as the commander, providing card advantage and recursion. The deck includes powerful cards such as Force of Will, Cryptic Command, and Liliana of the Veil to maintain control of the game. Additionally, the deck includes efficient threats like Snapcaster Mage and Vendilion Clique to pressure the opponent while controlling the game. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistency and access to all the necessary colors for the spells in the deck.
